newsitem.title: UK: MP Hamilton has right to stand in election-Major.
newsitem.headline: MP Hamilton has right to stand in election-Major.

text.p: Conservative member of parliament Neil Hamilton has the right to stand in the British election on May 1 so long as he has the support of his local party in Tatton, north west England, Prime Minister John Major said.
"Everyone who maintains the support of their constituency party and who protests their innocence has the right to stand at this election," Major told a news conference on Tuesday.

"That applies explicitly to Neil Hamilton, it applies as a general principle as well," he added. Hamilton is at the centre of sleaze allegations involving the receipt of payments for asking questions for businessmen in parliament.
